release.name: Vaadin Flow 2.8.2
release.body:
## Changes since [2.8.1](https://github.com/vaadin/flow/releases/tag/2.8.1)

[All changes](https://github.com/vaadin/flow/compare/2.8.1...2.8.2)

### New features

- **Add refresh flag to navigation event (#15324)**
  [Commit](https://github.com/vaadin/flow/commit/9b2c4b8) · [Pull request](https://github.com/vaadin/flow/pull/15333) · [Issue](https://github.com/vaadin/flow/issues/14999)

  Add the isRefreshEvent to BeforeEnterEvent and AfterNavigationEvent to be make it possible to distinguish if the event is for a refresh of a preserve on refresh view.

### Fixes

- **Component locale works without UI and i18n (#15344)**
  [Commit](https://github.com/vaadin/flow/commit/55268c1) · [Pull request](https://github.com/vaadin/flow/pull/15368) · [Issue](https://github.com/vaadin/flow/issues/15313)
- **Do not remove expanded items from key mapper (#15314)**
  [Commit](https://github.com/vaadin/flow/commit/3be3ef9) · [Pull request](https://github.com/vaadin/flow/pull/15360) · [Issue](https://github.com/vaadin/flow/issues/4133)

  With a TreeGrid, the expanded state of a root item gets lost when scrolled enough to request a new range. The cause for this is the updated key of the returned item. The expanded state for the items except the root items do not get lost. This PR makes sure that the key-value pair for a root item persists in the KeyMapper if the item is expanded. This change only affects hierarchical data. A test is added to ensure that the fix solves the issue. While this refactoring is less than ideal in terms of clean code, I think that the alternative requires a much larger refactoring. The logic in the regular and hierarchical data communicators are mostly both coupled and duplicated with private methods at this time. Therefore, this PR is as atomic as possible.
- **Remove unnecessary clear condition (#15282)**
  [Commit](https://github.com/vaadin/flow/commit/54adac7) · [Pull request](https://github.com/vaadin/flow/pull/15307) · [Issue](https://github.com/vaadin/flow/issues/4132)

  For hierarchical data, even when the child components are filtered out, the clear method on ArrayUpdater.Update in HierarchicalCommunicationController is never called. This is caused by an if check, in which the start index of previousActive is compared to the newly calculated assumedSize. Since there might be items to clear, the newly calculated size should have no effect on whether we clear the items or not. This check is not present in the DataCommunicator counterpart within the method collectChangesToSend. This PR removes the aforementioned clear condition. Add test to ensure that the expanded children are cleared properly when filtered out.
- **Empty alt in costructor should add property (#15292)**
  [Commit](https://github.com/vaadin/flow/commit/d39945e) · [Pull request](https://github.com/vaadin/flow/pull/15300) · [Issue](https://github.com/vaadin/flow/issues/14880)

  Giving the alternate text in the constructor should generate a property to the image.

issue.title: docs: add JSDoc to DatePickerI18n interface
issue.body:
## Description

During DX tests for the reference date one tester ended up exploring the TS interface for the date picker I18N object, however as it had no JSDoc it was not clear in which format to configure the date. In order to solve this they would have had to backtrack to the `i18n` property of the date picker and check the docs there.

We thought that it would be useful if the interface itself would be documented as well. The downside here is that for future changes this is an exception to our regular pattern of just copying docs between component JSDoc and TS definitions of the component itself, requiring further changes on a nested type that does not exist in the JS module.

issue.title: NullPointerException in Component.getLocale() if no I18NProvider configured
issue.body:
### Description of the bug

My application barfed this exception:
```
java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException: java.lang.NullPointerException
        at java.base/java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.report(FutureTask.java:122)
        at java.base/java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.get(FutureTask.java:191)
        at com.vaadin.flow.server.FutureAccess.get(FutureAccess.java:62)
        at com.vaadin.flow.server.VaadinService.runPendingAccessTasks(VaadinService.java:2062)
        at com.vaadin.flow.server.VaadinSession.unlock(VaadinSession.java:712)
        at com.vaadin.flow.server.VaadinService.ensureAccessQueuePurged(VaadinService.java:2025)
        at com.vaadin.flow.server.VaadinService.accessSession(VaadinService.java:1992)
        at com.vaadin.flow.server.VaadinSession.access(VaadinSession.java:1016)
        ...<snip>
Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
        at com.vaadin.flow.component.Component.getLocale(Component.java:750)
        at com.vaadin.flow.component.combobox.ComboBoxDataController.lambda$setDataProvider$9fbb9d72$1(ComboBoxDataController.java:457)
        at com.vaadin.flow.component.combobox.ComboBoxDataController.lambda$setDataProvider$13e91f97$1(ComboBoxDataController.java:484)
        at java.base/java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline$2$1.accept(ReferencePipeline.java:176)
        at java.base/java.util.ArrayList$ArrayListSpliterator.forEachRemaining(ArrayList.java:1655)
        at java.base/java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.copyInto(AbstractPipeline.java:484)
        at java.base/java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.wrapAndCopyInto(AbstractPipeline.java:474)
        at java.base/java.util.stream.ReduceOps$ReduceOp.evaluateSequential(ReduceOps.java:913)
        at java.base/java.util.stream.ReduceOps$5.evaluateSequential(ReduceOps.java:257)
        at java.base/java.util.stream.ReduceOps$5.evaluateSequential(ReduceOps.java:248)
        at java.base/java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.evaluate(AbstractPipeline.java:234)
        at java.base/java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline.count(ReferencePipeline.java:605)
        at com.vaadin.flow.data.provider.ListDataProvider.size(ListDataProvider.java:87)
        at com.vaadin.flow.data.provider.DataCommunicator.getDataProviderSize(DataCommunicator.java:923)
        at com.vaadin.flow.data.provider.DataCommunicator.getItemCount(DataCommunicator.java:527)
        at com.vaadin.flow.component.combobox.ComboBoxDataController.refreshAllData(ComboBoxDataController.java:566)
        at com.vaadin.flow.component.combobox.ComboBoxDataController.lambda$setupDataProviderListener$94e23d3c$1(ComboBoxDataController.java:635)
        at com.vaadin.flow.data.provider.AbstractDataProvider$1.accept(AbstractDataProvider.java:64)
        at com.vaadin.flow.data.provider.AbstractDataProvider$1.accept(AbstractDataProvider.java:61)
        at com.vaadin.flow.data.provider.AbstractDataProvider.fireEventForListener(AbstractDataProvider.java:147)
        at com.vaadin.flow.data.provider.AbstractDataProvider.lambda$fireEvent$2(AbstractDataProvider.java:133)
        at java.base/java.util.ArrayList.forEach(ArrayList.java:1541)
        at com.vaadin.flow.data.provider.AbstractDataProvider.lambda$fireEvent$3(AbstractDataProvider.java:132)
        at java.base/java.util.stream.ForEachOps$ForEachOp$OfRef.accept(ForEachOps.java:183)
        at java.base/java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline$2$1.accept(ReferencePipeline.java:177)
        at java.base/java.util.HashMap$EntrySpliterator.forEachRemaining(HashMap.java:1764)
        at java.base/java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.copyInto(AbstractPipeline.java:484)
        at java.base/java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.wrapAndCopyInto(AbstractPipeline.java:474)
        at java.base/java.util.stream.ForEachOps$ForEachOp.evaluateSequential(ForEachOps.java:150)
        at java.base/java.util.stream.ForEachOps$ForEachOp$OfRef.evaluateSequential(ForEachOps.java:173)
        at java.base/java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.evaluate(AbstractPipeline.java:234)
        at java.base/java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline.forEach(ReferencePipeline.java:497)
        at com.vaadin.flow.data.provider.AbstractDataProvider.fireEvent(AbstractDataProvider.java:132)
        at com.vaadin.flow.data.provider.AbstractDataProvider.refreshAll(AbstractDataProvider.java:72)
```

The exception occurred here in `Component.java`:
```java
    protected Locale getLocale() {
        UI currentUi = UI.getCurrent();
        Locale locale = currentUi == null ? null : currentUi.getLocale();
        if (locale == null) {
            List<Locale> locales = getI18NProvider().getProvidedLocales();  // 👈 👈 👈 👈 
            if (locales != null && !locales.isEmpty()) {
                locale = locales.get(0);
            } else {
                locale = Locale.getDefault();
            }
        }
        return locale;
    }   
```
Looks like this method incorrectly assumes that there is always either a current `UI` or a I18NProvider. In the case there is neither, you get an NPE.

Another bug like [#4204](https://github.com/vaadin/flow-components/issues/4204) where code assumes that there is always a current `UI`. This is not correct.

**Yes, there should always be a current locked `VaadinSession`, but when updates occur via background tasks there is no current `UI`.** 

### Expected behavior

There should be no NullPointerExceptions.

### Minimal reproducible example

Invoke `Component.getLocale()` when there is no current `UI` object and no I18NProvider configured.

### Versions

- Vaadin / Flow version: 23.2.7
- Java version: 11
- OS version: Linux

issue.title: Authentication API to get the current user and perform logout
issue.body:
### Describe your motivation

Start projects have the `AuthenticatedUser` bean which provides the current user and the logout feature. SSO Kit provides the [`AuthenticationContext`](https://github.com/vaadin/sso-kit/blob/main/sso-kit-starter/src/main/java/com/vaadin/sso/starter/AuthenticationContext.java) which is very similar.

If Flow would provide an API for this, it could be used both in Start projects and in SSO Kit.

### Describe the solution you'd like

This is the default implementation for SSO Kit: [SingleSignOnConfiguration.java#L199-L254](https://github.com/vaadin/sso-kit/blob/f0ccef4ce5a63d998be748318807602e233d285d/sso-kit-starter/src/main/java/com/vaadin/sso/starter/SingleSignOnConfiguration.java#L199-L254) which can be used as a starting point.

### Additional context

The API should be extendable/configurable enough to be able for other projects (e.g. SSO Kit) to add logout handlers.

comment.body: This ticket/PR has been released with Vaadin 23.3.0.rc1 and is also targeting the upcoming stable 23.3.0 version.

issue.title: feat: Add the Authentication Context bean to the Vaadin Web Security (#15129) (CP: 23.3)
issue.body:
- AuthenticationContext is a concrete class that gets access to the authenticated user and allows performing logout integrated with Spring Security
- AuthenticationContext is an injectable managed bean
- Developers can plug additional LogoutHandlers in VaadinWebSecurity.addLogoutHandlers()
- VaadinWebSecurity configures a LogoutSuccessHandler with a redirect strategy that can handle also XHR UIDL requests (UidlRedirectStrategy)

Fixes #14958

issue.title: fix: restore backward compatibility of new event classes
issue.body:
## Description

When sub-classing components, and using an implicit import for events such as `SplitterDragendEvent`, then the event classes introduced as an alternative to the deprecated events in generated classes can cause compilation errors. The problem is that the newly introduced event class now shadows the deprecated class, and the new class does not have the generic type param of the deprecated class.

Fixed this by adding a generic type param to the new event classes as well. The param will be dropped in v24, which will require developers to update their code during migration accordingly. The breaking change should be mentioned in the release notes, and in the migration guide.

Fixes https://github.com/vaadin/flow-components/issues/4286

## Type of change

- Bugfix

release.name: Vaadin Flow 2.8.2
release.body:
## Changes since [2.8.1](https://github.com/vaadin/flow/releases/tag/2.8.1)

[All changes](https://github.com/vaadin/flow/compare/2.8.1...2.8.2)

### New features

- **Add refresh flag to navigation event (#15324)**
  [Commit](https://github.com/vaadin/flow/commit/9b2c4b8) · [Pull request](https://github.com/vaadin/flow/pull/15333) · [Issue](https://github.com/vaadin/flow/issues/14999)

  Add the isRefreshEvent to BeforeEnterEvent and AfterNavigationEvent to be make it possible to distinguish if the event is for a refresh of a preserve on refresh view.

### Fixes

- **Component locale works without UI and i18n (#15344)**
  [Commit](https://github.com/vaadin/flow/commit/55268c1) · [Pull request](https://github.com/vaadin/flow/pull/15368) · [Issue](https://github.com/vaadin/flow/issues/15313)
- **Do not remove expanded items from key mapper (#15314)**
  [Commit](https://github.com/vaadin/flow/commit/3be3ef9) · [Pull request](https://github.com/vaadin/flow/pull/15360) · [Issue](https://github.com/vaadin/flow/issues/4133)

  With a TreeGrid, the expanded state of a root item gets lost when scrolled enough to request a new range. The cause for this is the updated key of the returned item. The expanded state for the items except the root items do not get lost. This PR makes sure that the key-value pair for a root item persists in the KeyMapper if the item is expanded. This change only affects hierarchical data. A test is added to ensure that the fix solves the issue. While this refactoring is less than ideal in terms of clean code, I think that the alternative requires a much larger refactoring. The logic in the regular and hierarchical data communicators are mostly both coupled and duplicated with private methods at this time. Therefore, this PR is as atomic as possible.
- **Remove unnecessary clear condition (#15282)**
  [Commit](https://github.com/vaadin/flow/commit/54adac7) · [Pull request](https://github.com/vaadin/flow/pull/15307) · [Issue](https://github.com/vaadin/flow/issues/4132)

  For hierarchical data, even when the child components are filtered out, the clear method on ArrayUpdater.Update in HierarchicalCommunicationController is never called. This is caused by an if check, in which the start index of previousActive is compared to the newly calculated assumedSize. Since there might be items to clear, the newly calculated size should have no effect on whether we clear the items or not. This check is not present in the DataCommunicator counterpart within the method collectChangesToSend. This PR removes the aforementioned clear condition. Add test to ensure that the expanded children are cleared properly when filtered out.
- **Empty alt in costructor should add property (#15292)**
  [Commit](https://github.com/vaadin/flow/commit/d39945e) · [Pull request](https://github.com/vaadin/flow/pull/15300) · [Issue](https://github.com/vaadin/flow/issues/14880)

  Giving the alternate text in the constructor should generate a property to the image.

issue.title: docs: add JSDoc to DatePickerI18n interface
issue.body:
## Description

During DX tests for the reference date one tester ended up exploring the TS interface for the date picker I18N object, however as it had no JSDoc it was not clear in which format to configure the date. In order to solve this they would have had to backtrack to the `i18n` property of the date picker and check the docs there.

We thought that it would be useful if the interface itself would be documented as well. The downside here is that for future changes this is an exception to our regular pattern of just copying docs between component JSDoc and TS definitions of the component itself, requiring further changes on a nested type that does not exist in the JS module.

issue.title: NullPointerException in Component.getLocale() if no I18NProvider configured
issue.body:
### Description of the bug

My application barfed this exception:
```
java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException: java.lang.NullPointerException
        at java.base/java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.report(FutureTask.java:122)
        at java.base/java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.get(FutureTask.java:191)
        at com.vaadin.flow.server.FutureAccess.get(FutureAccess.java:62)
        at com.vaadin.flow.server.VaadinService.runPendingAccessTasks(VaadinService.java:2062)

        at com.vaadin.flow.data.provider.AbstractDataProvider.refreshAll(AbstractDataProvider.java:72)
```

The exception occurred here in `Component.java`:
```java
    protected Locale getLocale() {
        UI currentUi = UI.getCurrent();
        Locale locale = currentUi == null ? null : currentUi.getLocale();
        if (locale == null) {
            List<Locale> locales = getI18NProvider().getProvidedLocales();  // 👈 👈 👈 👈 
            if (locales != null && !locales.isEmpty()) {
                locale = locales.get(0);
            } else {
                locale = Locale.getDefault();
            }
        }
        return locale;
    }   
```
Looks like this method incorrectly assumes that there is always either a current `UI` or a I18NProvider. In the case there is neither, you get an NPE.

Another bug like [#4204](https://github.com/vaadin/flow-components/issues/4204) where code assumes that there is always a current `UI`. This is not correct.

**Yes, there should always be a current locked `VaadinSession`, but when updates occur via background tasks there is no current `UI`.** 

### Expected behavior

There should be no NullPointerExceptions.

### Minimal reproducible example

Invoke `Component.getLocale()` when there is no current `UI` object and no I18NProvider configured.

### Versions

- Vaadin / Flow version: 23.2.7
- Java version: 11
- OS version: Linux

issue.title: Authentication API to get the current user and perform logout
issue.body:
### Describe your motivation

Start projects have the `AuthenticatedUser` bean which provides the current user and the logout feature. SSO Kit provides the [`AuthenticationContext`](https://github.com/vaadin/sso-kit/blob/main/sso-kit-starter/src/main/java/com/vaadin/sso/starter/AuthenticationContext.java) which is very similar.

If Flow would provide an API for this, it could be used both in Start projects and in SSO Kit.

### Describe the solution you'd like

This is the default implementation for SSO Kit: [SingleSignOnConfiguration.java#L199-L254](https://github.com/vaadin/sso-kit/blob/f0ccef4ce5a63d998be748318807602e233d285d/sso-kit-starter/src/main/java/com/vaadin/sso/starter/SingleSignOnConfiguration.java#L199-L254) which can be used as a starting point.

### Additional context

The API should be extendable/configurable enough to be able for other projects (e.g. SSO Kit) to add logout handlers.

comment.body: This ticket/PR has been released with Vaadin 23.3.0.rc1 and is also targeting the upcoming stable 23.3.0 version.

issue.title: feat: Add the Authentication Context bean to the Vaadin Web Security (#15129) (CP: 23.3)
issue.body:
- AuthenticationContext is a concrete class that gets access to the authenticated user and allows performing logout integrated with Spring Security
- AuthenticationContext is an injectable managed bean
- Developers can plug additional LogoutHandlers in VaadinWebSecurity.addLogoutHandlers()
- VaadinWebSecurity configures a LogoutSuccessHandler with a redirect strategy that can handle also XHR UIDL requests (UidlRedirectStrategy)

Fixes #14958

issue.title: fix: restore backward compatibility of new event classes
issue.body:
## Description

When sub-classing components, and using an implicit import for events such as `SplitterDragendEvent`, then the event classes introduced as an alternative to the deprecated events in generated classes can cause compilation errors. The problem is that the newly introduced event class now shadows the deprecated class, and the new class does not have the generic type param of the deprecated class.

Fixed this by adding a generic type param to the new event classes as well. The param will be dropped in v24, which will require developers to update their code during migration accordingly. The breaking change should be mentioned in the release notes, and in the migration guide.

Fixes https://github.com/vaadin/flow-components/issues/4286

## Type of change

- Bugfix

release.name: Vaadin Flow 2.8.2
release.body:
## Changes since [2.8.1](https://github.com/vaadin/flow/releases/tag/2.8.1)

[All changes](https://github.com/vaadin/flow/compare/2.8.1...2.8.2)

### New features

- **Add refresh flag to navigation event (#15324)**
  [Commit](https://github.com/vaadin/flow/commit/9b2c4b8) · [Pull request](https://github.com/vaadin/flow/pull/15333) · [Issue](https://github.com/vaadin/flow/issues/14999)

  Add the isRefreshEvent to BeforeEnterEvent and AfterNavigationEvent to be make it possible to distinguish if the event is for a refresh of a preserve on refresh view.

### Fixes

- **Component locale works without UI and i18n (#15344)**
  [Commit](https://github.com/vaadin/flow/commit/55268c1) · [Pull request](https://github.com/vaadin/flow/pull/15368) · [Issue](https://github.com/vaadin/flow/issues/15313)
- **Do not remove expanded items from key mapper (#15314)**
  [Commit](https://github.com/vaadin/flow/commit/3be3ef9) · [Pull request](https://github.com/vaadin/flow/pull/15360) · [Issue](https://github.com/vaadin/flow/issues/4133)

  With a TreeGrid, the expanded state of a root item gets lost when scrolled enough to request a new range. The cause for this is the updated key of the returned item. The expanded state for the items except the root items do not get lost. This PR makes sure that the key-value pair for a root item persists in the KeyMapper if the item is expanded. This change only affects hierarchical data. A test is added to ensure that the fix solves the issue. While this refactoring is less than ideal in terms of clean code, I think that the alternative requires a much larger refactoring. The logic in the regular and hierarchical data communicators are mostly both coupled and duplicated with private methods at this time. Therefore, this PR is as atomic as possible.
- **Remove unnecessary clear condition (#15282)**
  [Commit](https://github.com/vaadin/flow/commit/54adac7) · [Pull request](https://github.com/vaadin/flow/pull/15307) · [Issue](https://github.com/vaadin/flow/issues/4132)

  For hierarchical data, even when the child components are filtered out, the clear method on ArrayUpdater.Update in HierarchicalCommunicationController is never called. This is caused by an if check, in which the start index of previousActive is compared to the newly calculated assumedSize. Since there might be items to clear, the newly calculated size should have no effect on whether we clear the items or not. This check is not present in the DataCommunicator counterpart within the method collectChangesToSend. This PR removes the aforementioned clear condition. Add test to ensure that the expanded children are cleared properly when filtered out.
- **Empty alt in costructor should add property (#15292)**
  [Commit](https://github.com/vaadin/flow/commit/d39945e) · [Pull request](https://github.com/vaadin/flow/pull/15300) · [Issue](https://github.com/vaadin/flow/issues/14880)

  Giving the alternate text in the constructor should generate a property to the image.

issue.title: docs: add JSDoc to DatePickerI18n interface
issue.body:
## Description

During DX tests for the reference date one tester ended up exploring the TS interface for the date picker I18N object, however as it had no JSDoc it was not clear in which format to configure the date. In order to solve this they would have had to backtrack to the `i18n` property of the date picker and check the docs there.

We thought that it would be useful if the interface itself would be documented as well. The downside here is that for future changes this is an exception to our regular pattern of just copying docs between component JSDoc and TS definitions of the component itself, requiring further changes on a nested type that does not exist in the JS module.

issue.title: NullPointerException in Component.getLocale() if no I18NProvider configured
issue.body:
### Description of the bug

My application barfed this exception:
```
java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException: java.lang.NullPointerException
        at java.base/java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.report(FutureTask.java:122)
        at java.base/java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.get(FutureTask.java:191)
        at com.vaadin.flow.server.FutureAccess.get(FutureAccess.java:62)
        at com.vaadin.flow.server.VaadinService.runPendingAccessTasks(VaadinService.java:2062)
        at com.vaadin.flow.server.VaadinSession.unlock(VaadinSession.java:712)
        at com.vaadin.flow.server.VaadinService.ensureAccessQueuePurged(VaadinService.java:2025)
        at com.vaadin.flow.server.VaadinService.accessSession(VaadinService.java:1992)
        at com.vaadin.flow.server.VaadinSession.access(VaadinSession.java:1016)
        ...<snip>
Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
        at com.vaadin.flow.component.Component.getLocale(Component.java:750)
        at com.vaadin.flow.component.combobox.ComboBoxDataController.lambda$setDataProvider$9fbb9d72$1(ComboBoxDataController.java:457)
        at com.vaadin.flow.component.combobox.ComboBoxDataController.lambda$setDataProvider$13e91f97$1(ComboBoxDataController.java:484)
        at java.base/java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline$2$1.accept(ReferencePipeline.java:176)
        at java.base/java.util.ArrayList$ArrayListSpliterator.forEachRemaining(ArrayList.java:1655)
        at java.base/java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.copyInto(AbstractPipeline.java:484)
        at java.base/java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.wrapAndCopyInto(AbstractPipeline.java:474)
        at java.base/java.util.stream.ReduceOps$ReduceOp.evaluateSequential(ReduceOps.java:913)
        at java.base/java.util.stream.ReduceOps$5.evaluateSequential(ReduceOps.java:257)
        at java.base/java.util.stream.ReduceOps$5.evaluateSequential(ReduceOps.java:248)
        at java.base/java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.evaluate(AbstractPipeline.java:234)
        at java.base/java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline.count(ReferencePipeline.java:605)
        at com.vaadin.flow.data.provider.ListDataProvider.size(ListDataProvider.java:87)
        at com.vaadin.flow.data.provider.DataCommunicator.getDataProviderSize(DataCommunicator.java:923)
        at com.vaadin.flow.data.provider.DataCommunicator.getItemCount(DataCommunicator.java:527)
        at com.vaadin.flow.component.combobox.ComboBoxDataController.refreshAllData(ComboBoxDataController.java:566)
        at com.vaadin.flow.component.combobox.ComboBoxDataController.lambda$setupDataProviderListener$94e23d3c$1(ComboBoxDataController.java:635)
        at com.vaadin.flow.data.provider.AbstractDataProvider$1.accept(AbstractDataProvider.java:64)
        at com.vaadin.flow.data.provider.AbstractDataProvider$1.accept(AbstractDataProvider.java:61)
        at com.vaadin.flow.data.provider.AbstractDataProvider.fireEventForListener(AbstractDataProvider.java:147)
        at com.vaadin.flow.data.provider.AbstractDataProvider.lambda$fireEvent$2(AbstractDataProvider.java:133)
        at java.base/java.util.ArrayList.forEach(ArrayList.java:1541)
        at com.vaadin.flow.data.provider.AbstractDataProvider.lambda$fireEvent$3(AbstractDataProvider.java:132)
        at java.base/java.util.stream.ForEachOps$ForEachOp$OfRef.accept(ForEachOps.java:183)
        at java.base/java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline$2$1.accept(ReferencePipeline.java:177)
        at java.base/java.util.HashMap$EntrySpliterator.forEachRemaining(HashMap.java:1764)
        at java.base/java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.copyInto(AbstractPipeline.java:484)
        at java.base/java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.wrapAndCopyInto(AbstractPipeline.java:474)
        at java.base/java.util.stream.ForEachOps$ForEachOp.evaluateSequential(ForEachOps.java:150)
        at java.base/java.util.stream.ForEachOps$ForEachOp$OfRef.evaluateSequential(ForEachOps.java:173)
        at java.base/java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.evaluate(AbstractPipeline.java:234)
        at java.base/java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline.forEach(ReferencePipeline.java:497)
        at com.vaadin.flow.data.provider.AbstractDataProvider.fireEvent(AbstractDataProvider.java:132)
        at com.vaadin.flow.data.provider.AbstractDataProvider.refreshAll(AbstractDataProvider.java:72)
```

The exception occurred here in `Component.java`:
```java
    protected Locale getLocale() {
        UI currentUi = UI.getCurrent();
        Locale locale = currentUi == null ? null : currentUi.getLocale();
        if (locale == null) {
            List<Locale> locales = getI18NProvider().getProvidedLocales();  // 👈 👈 👈 👈 
            if (locales != null && !locales.isEmpty()) {
                locale = locales.get(0);
            } else {
                locale = Locale.getDefault();
            }
        }
        return locale;
    }   
```
Looks like this method incorrectly assumes that there is always either a current `UI` or a I18NProvider. In the case there is neither, you get an NPE.

Another bug like [#4204](https://github.com/vaadin/flow-components/issues/4204) where code assumes that there is always a current `UI`. This is not correct.

**Yes, there should always be a current locked `VaadinSession`, but when updates occur via background tasks there is no current `UI`.** 

### Expected behavior

There should be no NullPointerExceptions.

### Minimal reproducible example

Invoke `Component.getLocale()` when there is no current `UI` object and no I18NProvider configured.

### Versions

- Vaadin / Flow version: 23.2.7
- Java version: 11
- OS version: Linux

issue.title: Authentication API to get the current user and perform logout
issue.body:
### Describe your motivation

Start projects have the `AuthenticatedUser` bean which provides the current user and the logout feature. SSO Kit provides the [`AuthenticationContext`](https://github.com/vaadin/sso-kit/blob/main/sso-kit-starter/src/main/java/com/vaadin/sso/starter/AuthenticationContext.java) which is very similar.

If Flow would provide an API for this, it could be used both in Start projects and in SSO Kit.

### Describe the solution you'd like

This is the default implementation for SSO Kit: [SingleSignOnConfiguration.java#L199-L254](https://github.com/vaadin/sso-kit/blob/f0ccef4ce5a63d998be748318807602e233d285d/sso-kit-starter/src/main/java/com/vaadin/sso/starter/SingleSignOnConfiguration.java#L199-L254) which can be used as a starting point.

### Additional context

The API should be extendable/configurable enough to be able for other projects (e.g. SSO Kit) to add logout handlers.

comment.body: This ticket/PR has been released with Vaadin 23.3.0.rc1 and is also targeting the upcoming stable 23.3.0 version.

issue.title: feat: Add the Authentication Context bean to the Vaadin Web Security (#15129) (CP: 23.3)
issue.body:
- AuthenticationContext is a concrete class that gets access to the authenticated user and allows performing logout integrated with Spring Security
- AuthenticationContext is an injectable managed bean
- Developers can plug additional LogoutHandlers in VaadinWebSecurity.addLogoutHandlers()
- VaadinWebSecurity configures a LogoutSuccessHandler with a redirect strategy that can handle also XHR UIDL requests (UidlRedirectStrategy)

Fixes #14958

comment.body: This ticket/PR has been released with Vaadin 23.3.0.rc1 and is also targeting the upcoming stable 23.3.0 version.

issue.title: fix: restore backward compatibility of new event classes
issue.body:
## Description

When sub-classing components, and using an implicit import for events such as `SplitterDragendEvent`, then the event classes introduced as an alternative to the deprecated events in generated classes can cause compilation errors. The problem is that the newly introduced event class now shadows the deprecated class, and the new class does not have the generic type param of the deprecated class.

Fixed this by adding a generic type param to the new event classes as well. The param will be dropped in v24, which will require developers to update their code during migration accordingly. The breaking change should be mentioned in the release notes, and in the migration guide.

Fixes https://github.com/vaadin/flow-components/issues/4286

## Type of change

- Bugfix
